qas.question: What book did Frederick Lynch burn?
What did black males feel was happening to them as a result of affirmative action?
What moral position does Shelby Steele disagree with?
What does Shelby Steele believe that the false concept of affirmative action is?

context: Frederick Lynch, the author of <a0_0><b4_0>Invisible Victims: White Males and the Crisis of Affirmative Action<b4_0/><a0_0/>, did a study on white males that said they were victims of <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>reverse discrimination<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>. Lynch explains that these white men felt frustrated and unfairly victimized by affirmative action. Shelby Steele, another author <a2_0>against affirmative action<a2_0/>, wanted to see affirmative action go back to its original meaning of <a3_0><b7_0>enforcing equal opportunity<b7_0/><a3_0/>. He argued that blacks had to take full responsibility in their education and in maintaining a job. Steele believes that there is still a long way to go in America to reach our goals of eradicating discrimination.
